Posts.Content: On Feb 07, 2011 9:42 PM smoser wrote: I am taking Femara and monthly Zometa infusion That is it.. Thank you, Susan Susan, thank you for the info. When I had a recurrence in 2008, on the chest wall, just under the skin, I took Femara and the tumor melted away in a matter of two weeks.  So Femara might be the answer again.  We'll see,   Lisa
Posts.Title: BREAST CANCER MET TO LIVER

Posts.Title: BREAST CANCER MET TO LIVER

Posts.Content: On Jan 28, 2011 1:55 PM smoser wrote: Last month the scan didn't see my liver mets. Last June 2010 I had two lesions on my liver/cancer Now it doesn't show on the recent scan, plus tumor markers in the mid 20's( fabulous/last yr. marker 146-bad bad) What are the odds for cancer to again show up in Liver? I am stage 4   what treatment did you get for your liver mets?  I just found out Friday I have liver mets.  My bone mets have been in control since treatment started last Jan. w/ arimidex/zometa/zolodex.
Posts.Title: BREAST CANCER MET TO LIVER

Posts.Content: On Feb 17, 2011 9:14 PM mkkjd60 wrote: Hello,  My mom has kjust been diagnosed bc to liver.  She was 5 years after mastectomy, chemo (8 rounds) and arimidex.  We just came from the dr.  Her suggestion is monthly injections of Faslodex followed by scans in a few months.  I agree that it does seem like a long time to wait.  Have you heard of anyone getting chemo first to shrink it and then the Faslodex?  Dr. says some physicians go this route.  I am going to Sloan Kettering next week for a consult and will be glad to let you know.  Stay strong and blessings to you all. Thank you, yes, I would love hear what Sloan Kettering says.  I'm sorry your mom is going through this.  My doctor (at Georgetown) is giving me chemo (taxol/carboplatin/avastin) to shrink the tumors, and then the next step she hinted at would be Faslodex shots.    I'm getting my files together to get a second opinion, either from Johns Hopkins and/or MD Anderson in Texas.  This cancer is sneaky.
